notesStmt.note:
Daniyel ben Yitsḥaḳ of Ventura: inscribed with his name in the colophon, Bologna, [5]261 [1501] (folio 140r); the word Daniel is decorated (folio 72v).
Avraham Farissol: inscribed with his name in the colophon, [5]262 [1502] (folio 182v).
Daṿid Marḳ of Cine bar Avraham: inscribed with his name in the colophon upon the erased name of the patron (folio 182v).
Riḳah, the sister of Daniyel ben Yitsḥaḳ of Ventura, wife of Eli῾ezer of Rovigo, first owner: inscribed with her name in the colophon, Bologna, [5]261 [1501] (folio 140r).
Dominico Irosolimitano (fl. 1585-1624): inscribed with his name (folio 182v); see 62-74.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A daily prayer book, according to the Italian rite.

msItem.title: Special portions for Rosh ḥodesh, Purim etc.

collation.p: 18 quires: i-xii10 (folios 1-120), xiii8 (folios 121-128), xiv10 (folios 129-138), xv12 (folios 139-150), xvi-xvii10 (folios 151-170), xviii14-2 (folios 171-182). Catchwords at the end of the quires.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian semi-cursive, Ashkenazi and Provencal square script, punctuated. Daniyel ben Yitsḥaḳ of Ventura (folios 1-143) and Avraham Farissol (folios 144-182).

decoDesc.decoNote: 1r 1 decorated initial-word panel and full border, in colours and gold.
9vFloral decoration around the text, in ink.

binding.p: Post-1600. Ivory leather. Spine: 'Siddur. Roman Use. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,029.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), Italian bibliophile: his manuscript no. 135 (inscribed, folio [185v]); 322 Hebrew manuscripts were acquired from his library by the British Museum in 1865 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, [183v].
